alert.note: Alert for Ionia (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 6:13PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Michigan, including the following counties, Clinton, Eaton and Ionia. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying areas along the river continues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 PM EST, based on earlier reports by local Emergency Management, it is likely that an ice jam on the Grand River downstream of the Jones road bridge continues. This ice jam is resulting in flooding at the Jones road bridge and along other low-lying areas. - Ice jams are notoriously unpredictable, and can result in water level changes much faster than typically experienced on the Grand River. If you live along the river in this area, pay extra attention to river conditions and have a plan to respond if water levels start changing quickly. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
